name: Holiday Inn Miami Beach

reviews.text: The hotel itself is ok and have all of what you expect of a holiday inn and beach front access. the room we ok as well nothing special. the bed was felt old and was sinking in the middle. One thing that stood out was the service from one of the out side bell boy, an older gentlemen with New York accent. I got charge twice on my credit card for a drink I purchase at the pool bar by the front desk at checkout, that is a pain cause you have to deal with that after then trip back home and it could take a while to get it straighten out.
reviews.title: Avrage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived to the friendliest of receptions by Manny the night manager. Well stocked room overlooking great beach.
reviews.title: Great, friendly hotel; fantastic location!

reviews.text: Food, beer and service was tasty, cold and friendly in that order.
reviews.title: Trip to South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go out of the rear of the hotek, past the pool and you're right on the boardwalk by the long, clean and welcoming beach. Grabbed loungers and sunshade for $25 for the day and let your worries disappear.
reviews.title: Miami Beach Hotel

reviews.text: $33 is standard taxi fare from airport to hotel/Miami Beach.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on points and the location, right on the beach, is nice. Waited way too long to get someone to check me in. Only one person working the desk. When I finally got to the front of the line, the person checking me in took two phone calls (hate this!) ignoring me. The room was OK, just that, OK. But, it's on the beach with a nice boardwalk that 20 minutes later, you'll be in South Beach!
reviews.title: blah hotel that needs to improve on their customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights post-cruise here, at the north end of Miami Beach about 30 blocks from the South Beach area. Even though the hotel is showing it's age in design and layout, obvious upgrades and maintenance make it clean and inviting. The pool is right off the lobby, adjacent to the long boardwalk and beach. There is a poolside bar and cafe, and a restaurant and bar in the lobby too. The staff was very attentive and informative, the rooms clean and well appointed, and the lobby atmosphere inviting. The only real letdown was the miserable wireless internet! Completely unreliable, requiring constant sign-in's, and not extending to the outdoor areas. This was aggravated by the fact that the "Business Center" was apparently run by a third party, and cost $.25 a minute to use the computer, and $.25 a copy to print things like boarding passes.
reviews.title: Nice older hotel...with a great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here February 19, 2012 to February 23, 2012.
reviews.title: Smoking allowed in a non-smoking hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I decided to make a last minute trip to Miami. Many of the hotels were full due to the boat show and although we usually stay at Hilton or Westin brands, we decided to give Holiday Inn a chance due to the great location. We booked an oceanfront king hotel room.
reviews.title: Decent value on the beach, but not a favorite.

reviews.text: We were greatly disappointed in the actions of the staff and a man who appeared to be the manager. Our first night, we had no problems. However, our second night there (February 20), both my husband and I woke up multiple times in the middle night to the smell of cigarette smoke. Since the windows were screwed shut, we couldn't figure out where the smoke was coming from. The next morning (February 21) we awoke to smoke. I also awoke sneezing as I am allergic to smoke. I called the front desk to let them know that we smelled cigarette smoke and we thought it was coming from the adjacent room. After we went to the beach, we came back up to get ready for dinner and once again smelled cigarette smoke. I went to the front desk and they informed me that it was a non-smoking hotel and that we should not be smelling the smoke and that they would look into it. After getting back from dinner, a few minutes later we smelled smoke again. We also heard through the adjacent room a woman say, "get me my [--] cigarettes." I am assuming they were attempting to open the windows and smoke out them, but the smell was overwhelming.
reviews.title: Not That Great

reviews.text: Clean hotel, and close to nearby attractions - lincoln road pedestrian mall, south beach and a 30 minute bus ride to Aventura mall. This hotel is right on the beach and next to the famous Foutainblu hotel....where all the celebs stay. It was cool seeing paparazzi taking pics of someone sitting near us on the beach. Clean rooms and nice pool. Breakfast buffet was great also....we mostly walked to blocks south and went to a local bakery/deli. They had fresh cappuccinos and bagels, pastries, etc. at a good price. Would definitely recommend!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel does not live upto the Holiday Inn name. Lobby area is reasonable, but as one proceeds towards the room you can see that this is an old hotel, which has not gotten the proper upgrading that it needs. We were suppose to have a ocean view room, but were not able to see the ocean from our beds. The hotel is not exactly an ocean friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Needs lot of TLC

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at this hotel with Priority club points and we were extreamly satisfied with the hotel choice. The hotel is right on the beach and had a really nice pool area. The amount of points needed were same as the hotels near the airport and by the Port of Miami so it was a no brainer to choose this one. I tried first to get a different hotel down the street in South Beach and when I saw that it was not on the beach like this Holiday Inn was I knew I would have been extreamly disapointed and was glad they did not have reward nights available when we were there. This hotel was very clean and up to date, the staff was very nice and friendly. The brunch was very good also but the service was a little slow and we felt as if they forgot about us, but other then that we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: So glad my first choice was not available!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Functional rooms containing all you need for a short stay. It has clean rooms and comfortable beds including a selection of pillows either soft or firm. We had spent two nights there and have enjoyed the breakfast buffet (it was a rich buffet and they had orange juice that tasted natural and not so artificial which was a nice surprise). Unfortunately there is not much around the hotel if you are looking for fun, but Lincoln street is only a few minutes by bus away (one way drive 2 dollars). The beach was clean and nice for relaxing.
reviews.title: functional but nothing special

reviews.text: I cannot think of a single reason to stay at this hotel. The rooms are small and outdated. The air conditioning is mediocre. There is nothing nearby and its a long walk or drive to the fun of South Beach. One morning there was no water in room so we could not even flush toilets. Valet parking is expensive. Overall, I did not enjoy my stay.
reviews.title: No Reason to Stay Here

reviews.text: Dumpy and Old. Poor customer service. The only advantage is that is extemely close to the beach. The typical answer if you ask the staff for something is "I'm sorry I can't do that"!
reviews.title: Outdated. Typical poor customer service in Miami Beach

reviews.text: Not that much to do around the hotel other than the beach. It's a cab ride to Lincoln Road mall area.
reviews.title: what a nice hotel

reviews.text: hotel is clean, nice, save, good location near south beach 5 minuts by car, exceptional pool area and beach, good size room but no refrigirator, clean bathroom and comfortable bed, helpful front disk, delecious breakfast buffet, good price, recommend it and welll stay there again.
reviews.title: Fair choice

reviews.text: This is an average hotel in the Miami Beach. It is located beachfront on the North side of the city of Miami Beach.  It is a little away from the hustle and bustle of South Beach which is not a bad thing.
reviews.title: Not bad for the price, but adjust your expectations accordingly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an older building but it is to Holiday Inn standards.
reviews.title: Tired and dated

aka: Holiday Inn Miami Beach Hotel Miami Beach
description: Miami Beach hotel has a premium oceanfront location! Welcome to the tropically inspired Holiday Inn Miami Beach - Oceanfront, where our 1950's Miami Modern exterior blends seamlessly with vibrant contemporary South Beach style to wrap you in modern comfort. Eleven miles east of Miami International Airport, our Miami Beach hotel is located where I-195 meets A1A at the Atlantic Ocean.Our hotel in Miami Beach offers you an unparalleled location, with the Atlantic Ocean's sandy beaches as our backyard. Follow the South Beach Boardwalk into the Art Deco world of South Beach for shopping, dining or the vibrant nightclubs. Take a moonlit stroll on the beach by night and play in the surf by day, or simply relax by our large pool overlooking the beach and our lush, tropical garden with its hammock oasis; it's a great way to spend a sunny afternoon. Families will find it easy to get to Miami's museums and attractions, as many are within 15 miles of our hotel.Business guests appreciate the close proximity of our hotel to the Miami Beach Convention Center, two miles away. Our Miami Beach accommodations are within 10 miles of Sony, Mt. Sinai Hospital and the University of Miami. The free wireless Internet access will help you stay in touch while you travel.Our non-smoking hotel is perfect for a Miami Beach trip. You can enjoy a delicious meal at our Paradise Cafe, dine in your room, or have a yummy Mojito at our Blue Parrot Bar. We have it all.
